name: Youth Hostel Luxembourg City

reviews.text: WiFi in rooms. The interior looks fresh and new, and the hostel is clean. Remember to bring your own towels. Breakfast in the morning is basic (toast and cereal).
reviews.title: Clean and nice

reviews.text: The building and the location looked great, like it was brand new or so. Very bright inside. Quiet area and very green around. The staff at reception was nice.
reviews.title: Clean hostel with good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The dorms were very clean and so were the bathrooms. I didn't meet anyone in the hostel as I didn't spend much time there and was alone in the dorm too but I enjoyed its cleanliness and basic but nice furniture.
reviews.title: Excellent in general

reviews.text: They offer a shuttle service to the main train station, which I thought was quite enjoyable as I really didn't feel like taking the bus to town as I was quite tired.
reviews.title: Short of cash? Beware the hidden costs!

reviews.text: As for the costs I thought it was a bit expensive but it's average price for Luxembourg...
reviews.title: Luxembourg City YHA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hostel,
reviews.title: Pleasant stay and great place to visit!

reviews.text: Me and my partner stayed in a 6 bed dorm, it was clean and tidy. the breakfast was good and the location was excellent,
reviews.title: Modern, clean hostel very close to the city centre

reviews.text: The casemates are really close and a fantastic walk!
reviews.title: Pretty good, even though it is the only game in town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In a expensive city we opted to stay in a hostel with our 3 other friends, 5 in total. We all stayed in a dorm room together. The hostel is a short walk from the city centre and close to lots of nightlife and bars. The hostel seems fairly new and is very clean and modern.
reviews.title: This Place is Awesome.

reviews.text: Reception staff were happy to store bags and give directions. It is a big place though so not a lot of personal touch and was very noisy during the night for those of us who forgot their earplugs. Seems to cater for large groups.
reviews.title: Tidy and friendly

reviews.text: The cheapest (and only) option for visiting the expensive Luxembourg during a long w/e (Whit Monday) when in the whole country and even along the route to the nearby city of Trier in Germany, only a handful of super-expensive hotels remained available. I booked through booking.com and upon my arrival I was impressed by the scenery (under an aqueduct) and the modern look. The last time I checked-in a “youth hostel” was before 15 years. … Perhaps things have changed ever since, but it was not at all intended for youth only. People of all age ranges … from noisy junior school kids playing hide-&-seek and running in the corridors … to pensioneers and families. I paid with my credit card and filled-in the registration forms, but couldn’t get a room key because it was “too-early”. I visited the town, that you can easily access on foot in 10mins. Above the youth hostel, in a steep uphill and just 2-3 mins walk is the Dent Creuse (Hollow tooth …remainings of the very first Luxembourg castle and also the entrance to Cassemates Bock). So the hostel is ideally located for sight-seeing and access to the town. Added bonus, the Free parking.
reviews.title: Unsurpassed value for money

reviews.text: When I returned in the afternoon to get the key-card to my room, I found out that it was fully occupied… I returned to the reception, and got the room key for a “mixed” dormitory … that was totally free. Well, I didn’t enjoy that “exclusive” use for the whole night, since at 03:00 in the morning, I woke up by a couple of motorcyclists that checked in… The facilities are clean, but at a sunny and humid day, the corridors ventilation was inexistent. Breaksfast (served from 06:30 -09:00) was average … you could fill-up with ham&cheese sandwitches, butter&honey bread slices and cereals. It became above average when a basket with kiwi and green apples appeared… but soon was empty and never re-filled. Last but not least, after I checked-out I was charged extra 3.44 EUR. I have SMS alerting for all charges incurring to my credit card, so I called them immediately. They didn’t know what this charge was for … They tried to explain that it is probalby for the booking site. I explained that I was quoted a unified price … and I don’t care how much is for the hostel organization, for city tax and for booking fees, and it is totally unacceptable to have unauthorized charges, after my check-out … even for such small amounts. All in all, even with the not-authorized and non-explained charges, the total cost of the stay and the proximity to city made it well worth it.
reviews.title: Another Excellent Hostel

reviews.text: This hostel is definitely top-notch...I suppose that should not be a surprise, considering that it is located in Luxembourg!
reviews.title: Very nice and well located

reviews.text: It is set in the city's famous valley, which is very beautiful. And, it is only a ten-minute walk into the town. I enjoyed its location because it was peaceful.
reviews.title: Great value for money - great location

reviews.text: The rooms and the bathrooms were very good. Clean and well-equipped. The Wifi was also free of charge and there is a nice common room with a TV and big couches.
reviews.title: budget stay in Luxembourg

reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, this "hostel" was of good quality, but it was weird. There were families, many older men and women, more than I've ever seen at a "hostel". I was staying two nights and heard that they were forcing you to change rooms after the first night. After hearing this I went to ask the receptionist if I could stay in the same room and she said it was no problem to stay and leave my bags. I came back later in the evening to find my key was not working. When I went to get it fixed, they told me I was supposed to change rooms and they had already checked in six more people into the room with all of my things. I was not happy. Breakfast was good. Everything was clean. It was kind of a walk from the center, but a beautiful one at that.
reviews.title: Youth? Hostel? No. But it was nice!

reviews.text: The hostel itself is average for europeen standards.
reviews.title: a bit ridiculous

reviews.text: The offer a shuttle service, as the hostel is situated far out in a deep valley.
reviews.title: Worth to stay a nite!

reviews.text: I waited for 2 hours, the shuttle passed me by 2 times.
reviews.title: Not a hostel experiance

reviews.text: 2nd time I tried to talk to a staff member in this shuttle, wishing him a good morning and excusing me in a friendly tone.
reviews.title: First time in a hotel, better than expected

aka: Youth Hostel Luxembourg City Hotel Luxembourg City
